original: rdul chung ba'i rigs mchis te /
analyzed: rdul chung ba'i rigs mchis te /
translated: those who have little dust and those who have much dust.

original: de dag gis dam pa'i chos ma thos na yongs su nyams par gyur pas /
analyzed: de dag gis dam pa'i chos ma thos na yongs su nyams par gyur pas /
translated: If they do not hear the sublime Dharma, they will fall away.

original: chos rin po che 'tshal bar 'gyur ba mchis kyis /
analyzed: chos rin po che 'tshal bar 'gyur ba mchis kyis /
translated: They will seek the precious Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos bshad du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please teach the Dharma!

original: bde bar gshegs pa chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa chos bshad du gsol /
translated: Well-Gone One, please teach the Dharma!”🔽Then the Blessed One thought,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: “Alas!

original: ma la nga nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la blta bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: ma la nga nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la blta bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “Mother, I will look out upon the world with the eye of a Buddha.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One looked out upon the world with the eye of a Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / 'jig rten du skyes shing 'jig rten du rgas pa'i sems can rnams la dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po 'bring po dang / dbang po rtul po dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / 'jig rten du skyes shing 'jig rten du rgas pa'i sems can rnams la dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po 'bring po dang / dbang po rtul po dang /
translated: When the Blessed One looked out upon the world with the eye of a Buddha, he saw that among the beings who had been born in the world and were growing old in the world, there were those with sharp faculties, those with middling faculties, and those with dull faculties.

original: drang sla ba dang gdul sla ba dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / rdul chung ba'i rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: drang sla ba dang gdul sla ba dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / rdul chung ba'i rang bzhin yod de /
translated: There were those who were easy to purify, easy to train, and had few defilements and little dust.

original: de dag dam pa'i chos ma thos na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba gzigs so //
analyzed: de dag dam pa'i chos ma thos na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba gzigs so //
translated: If they did not hear the true Dharma, they would fall into ruin.

original: gzigs nas kyang sems can rnams la thugs rje chen po gzhol bar gyur to //
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang sems can rnams la thugs rje chen po gzhol bar gyur to //
translated: When he saw this, the Blessed One’s great compassion was aroused for those beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke in verse:

original: bdud rtsi sgo mo dag ni dbye @57b bar byas //🔽nyan par su 'dod som nyi sol cig dang // tshangs pa mi rnams la ni gya nom chos //
analyzed: bdud rtsi sgo mo dag ni dbye @57b bar byas // nyan par su 'dod som nyi sol cig dang // tshangs pa mi rnams la ni gya nom chos //
translated: And open the door to the nectar of immortality.🔽Those who wish to listen, resolve your doubts,🔽And I will briefly explain the sublime Dharma to humans.

original: klan ka mi btsal mdo tsam bshad par bya //
analyzed: klan ka mi btsal mdo tsam bshad par bya //
translated: Do not seek to find fault, but listen.

original: de nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, thought,

original: kye bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “The Blessed One will teach the Dharma!

original: kye bde bar gshegs pas chos bshad par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba rgya chen po dang yid bde ba skyes nas /
analyzed: kye bde bar gshegs pas chos bshad par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba rgya chen po dang yid bde ba skyes nas /
translated: The Well-Gone One will teach the Dharma!” Knowing this, he was filled with joy, delight, and supreme happiness, and experienced vast joy and mental ease.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te /
translated: He bowed his head to the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
translated: circumambulated him three times,

original: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: and then disappeared.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ngas su la thog mar chos bshad snyam mo //
analyzed: ngas su la thog mar chos bshad snyam mo //
translated: “To whom should I first teach the Dharma?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ma la ngas sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur de la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ma la ngas sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur de la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
translated: “Well then, I will first teach the Dharma to Mārapāpīya.

original: de ni nga'i thog ma'i slob dpon kho na yin bzhin du rjed pa'i dam pas rjed cing /
analyzed: de ni nga'i thog ma'i slob dpon kho na yin bzhin du rjed pa'i dam pas rjed cing /
translated: He was my very first teacher, and I honored him with the highest honor.

original: mchod pa'i dam pas mchod la /
analyzed: mchod pa'i dam pas mchod la /
translated: I worshiped him with the highest worship.

original: rtogs pa dam pa dag la yang yid rangs shing dad par gyur pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rtogs pa dam pa dag la yang yid rangs shing dad par gyur pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: And I delighted in and had faith in his highest realization.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyis gsol pa /
translated: The gods said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur gum nas dgung bdun lon lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur gum nas dgung bdun lon lags so //
translated: “Lord, it has been seven days since Mārapāpīya died.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dgongs pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dgongs pa la zhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One also reflected,

original: ye shes gzigs pa bskyed na sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi nas zhag bdun lon no //
analyzed: ye shes gzigs pa bskyed na sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi nas zhag bdun lon no //
translated: “If I generate the wisdom vision, it has been seven days since Mārapāpīya died.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs @58a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs @58a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,🔽“Well then, I will first teach the Dharma to Udraka Rāmaputra.”

original: te; ae ma'o sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi ba de ni te bor ma stes te /
analyzed: te; ae ma'o sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi ba de ni te bor ma stes te /
translated: “Alas, it is too bad that the son of Māṭhara, who had mastered the arts, has died.

original: ae ma'o sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi ba de ni shin tu te bor ma stes te /
analyzed: ae ma'o sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring du 'phur shi ba de ni shin tu te bor ma stes te /
translated: Alas, it is too bad that the son of Māṭhara, who had mastered the arts, has died.

original: chos 'dul ba 'di ma thos so //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di ma thos so //
translated: He did not hear this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gal te des chos 'dul ba 'di thos nas shes par 'gyur ba zhig snyam mo //
analyzed: gal te des chos 'dul ba 'di thos nas shes par 'gyur ba zhig snyam mo //
translated: If he had heard this Dharma and Vinaya, he would have understood it.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ma la ngas thog mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la ngas thog mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam mo //
translated: “To whom should I first teach the Dharma?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ma la ngas rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod de la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ma la ngas rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod de la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
translated: “I should first teach the Dharma to Udraka Rāmaputra.

original: de ni nga'i thog ma'i slob dpon kho na yin bzhin du rjed pa'i dam pas rjed cing mchod pa'i dam pas mchod la rtogs pa dam pa dag la yang yi rangs shing dad par gyur to snyam mo //
analyzed: de ni nga'i thog ma'i slob dpon kho na yin bzhin du rjed pa'i dam pas rjed cing mchod pa'i dam pas mchod la rtogs pa dam pa dag la yang yi rangs shing dad par gyur to snyam mo //
translated: He was my teacher in the past, and I honored him with the highest honor and worshiped him with the highest worship, and I rejoiced in his excellent realization and had faith in him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyis gsol pa /
translated: The gods said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ma dang gsum srod la gum lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ma dang gsum srod la gum lags so //
translated: “Venerable Gautama, the son of Rāma, Udraka, died last night, along with his two wives.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dgongs pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dgongs pa la zhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One also entered into meditation.

original: ye shes gzigs pa bskyed na /
analyzed: ye shes gzigs pa bskyed na /
translated: When he generated the vision of wisdom,

original: rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod srod la shi bar gyur to //
analyzed: rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod srod la shi bar gyur to //
translated: he saw that the son of Rāma, Udraka, had died last night.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /🔽ae ma'o rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod shi ba de ni te bor ma stes te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te / ae ma'o rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod shi ba de ni te bor ma stes te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,🔽“Alas, the death of Udraka, the son of Rāma, is a great loss.

original: ae ma'o rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod shi ba de ni shin tu te bor ma stes te /
analyzed: ae ma'o rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod shi ba de ni shin tu te bor ma stes te /
translated: Alas, the death of Udraka, the son of Rāma, is a great loss.

original: 'dul ba 'di ma thos so //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'di ma thos so //
translated: He did not hear this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gal te des chos 'dul ba 'di thos na shes par 'gyur ba zhig snyam mo //
analyzed: gal te des chos 'dul ba 'di thos na shes par 'gyur ba zhig snyam mo //
translated: If he had heard this Dharma and Vinaya, he would have understood it.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ma la ngas thog @58b mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la ngas thog @58b mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam mo //
translated: “Whom should I teach the Dharma to first?”

original: de nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then he thought,

original: ma la ngas lnga sde'i dge slong de rnams la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ma la ngas lnga sde'i dge slong de rnams la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
translated: “I will first teach the Dharma to the five monks.

original: de dag gis nga sngon sdug bsngal sbong ba'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson par gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis nga sngon sdug bsngal sbong ba'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson par gnas pa na /
translated: They were the ones who served me when I was striving in the practice of austerities.

original: bla ma dang gus pa dang / sdug pa dang bcas pas gnas pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: bla ma dang gus pa dang / sdug pa dang bcas pas gnas pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: They were my teachers, my superiors, and my friends.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: lnga sde'i dge slong rnams da ltar gang na 'dug snyam nas /
analyzed: lnga sde'i dge slong rnams da ltar gang na 'dug snyam nas /
translated: “Where are the five monks now?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas lnga sde'i dge slong rnams w'a ra n'a si na drang srong sma ba ri dvags kyi nags na 'khod pa gzigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas lnga sde'i dge slong rnams w'a ra n'a si na drang srong sma ba ri dvags kyi nags na 'khod pa gzigs so //
translated: With his pure divine eye, which surpasses the human, the Blessed One saw that the five monks were staying in the Deer Park in Vṛji, in the region of Kṛmiśa.

original: gzigs nas kyang ci tsam bzhed kyi bar du byang chub kyi drung du zhugs nas /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang ci tsam bzhed kyi bar du byang chub kyi drung du zhugs nas /
translated: Having seen this, he stayed at the foot of the Bodhi tree for as long as he wished,

original: w'a ra n'a si'i ka shi'i grong rdal gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs so //
analyzed: w'a ra n'a si'i ka shi'i grong rdal gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs so //
translated: and then he set out for Vārāṇasī, traveling through the region of Kāśi.

original: de'i tshe kun tu 'tsho nyer 'gro lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun tu 'tsho nyer 'gro lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur te /
translated: At that time, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa was on the road.

analyzed: kun tu 'tsho nyer 'gros bcom ldan 'das lam nas gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the Blessed One on the road.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he saw him, he said,

original: dge sbyong go'u ta ma khyod kyi dbang po rnams ni dvangs //
analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma khyod kyi dbang po rnams ni dvangs //
translated: “Gautama, the ascetic, your faculties are clear.

original: bzhin gyi mdog ni yongs su dag /
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdog ni yongs su dag /
translated: Your complexion is completely pure.

original: pags pa'i mdog ni gsal na /
analyzed: pags pa'i mdog ni gsal na /
translated: Your skin is radiant.

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma khyod kyi ston pa ni gang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma khyod kyi ston pa ni gang /
translated: Venerable Gautama, who is your teacher?

original: khyod su las brten te rab tu byung /
analyzed: khyod su las brten te rab tu byung /
translated: From whom did you go forth?

original: khyod su'i chos la dga'/
analyzed: khyod su'i chos la dga'/
translated: What Dharma do you like?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /🔽nga dang 'dra ba yod min pas //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa / nga dang 'dra ba yod min pas //
translated: The Blessed One spoke a verse:🔽“There is no one like me,

original: nga la slob dpon 'ga' med do //
analyzed: nga la slob dpon 'ga' med do //
translated: so I have no teacher at all.

original: 'jig rten sangs rgyas nga gcig pu //
analyzed: 'jig rten sangs rgyas nga gcig pu //
translated: I am the only buddha in the world,

original: yang @59a *// dag byang chub dam pa thob //🔽thams cad zil gnon 'jig rten kun mkhyen la //
analyzed: yang @59a *// dag byang chub dam pa thob // thams cad zil gnon 'jig rten kun mkhyen la //
translated: who has attained supreme, perfect awakening.

original: 'di ni chos kun gyis ni nga ma gos //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kun gyis ni nga ma gos //
translated: I am the one who has overcome everything, the omniscient one in the world.🔽I am not stained by any phenomena.”

original: thams cad spangs shing sred bral rnam grol te;/
analyzed: thams cad spangs shing sred bral rnam grol te;/
translated: “Abandoning everything, free from craving, liberated,

original: rang gis mngon par shes na su la brten //
analyzed: rang gis mngon par shes na su la brten //
translated: Having realized it for myself, on whom should I rely?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lha mi'i ston pa po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lha mi'i ston pa po //
translated: The Tathāgata, the teacher of gods and humans,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs ni kun ldan pas //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs ni kun ldan pas //
translated: Possessing all the powers of omniscience,

original: nyid kyis byang chub rtogs nas rab gsungs pa //
analyzed: nyid kyis byang chub rtogs nas rab gsungs pa //
translated: Having realized enlightenment for myself, I have proclaimed it

original: mi mnyam mtshungs pa med na su la brten //🔽nga ni 'jig rten dgra bcom ste //
analyzed: mi mnyam mtshungs pa med na su la brten // nga ni 'jig rten dgra bcom ste //
translated: To those who are unequalled and incomparable, on whom should I rely?🔽“I am the Victorious One, the Worthy One in the world,

original: 'jig rten bla med nga yin pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten bla med nga yin pas //
translated: I am the unsurpassed one in the world,

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na //
translated: In the world with its gods

original: nga ni rgyal ba bdud zil gnon //
analyzed: nga ni rgyal ba bdud zil gnon //
translated: I am the Victorious One, the conqueror of Māra.

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma /
translated: “Venerable Gautama,

original: rgyal ba zhes gsung ngam /
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes gsung ngam /
translated: Do you call yourself the Victorious One?

original: gang gis zag pa zad thob pa //
analyzed: gang gis zag pa zad thob pa //
translated: “Whoever has attained the exhaustion of defilements,

original: rgyal ba nga 'drar shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba nga 'drar shes par bya //
translated: Should be known as a Victorious One like me.🔽Since I have conquered evil qualities,

analyzed: sdig pa'i chos ni ngas bcom pas; ;de bas nyer 'gro nga rgyal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, Ārāḍa, I am the Victorious One.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u tam gang du bzhud /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u tam gang du bzhud /
translated: “Where will Venerable Gautama go?”

original: w'a ra n'a sir gshegs nas ni //
analyzed: w'a ra n'a sir gshegs nas ni //
translated: “Having gone to Vārāṇasī,

original: ngas ni chos kyi rnga brdung zhing //
analyzed: ngas ni chos kyi rnga brdung zhing //
translated: I will beat the drum of the Dharma,

original: 'jig rten na ma bskor gang yin pa'i; ;chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ma bskor gang yin pa'i; ;chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor //
translated: You have turned the wheel of Dharma,🔽Which had not been turned in the world.

original: 'jig rten chags las rgal ba yi //
analyzed: 'jig rten chags las rgal ba yi //
translated: You have crossed over the world’s attachment,

original: kun mkhyen sangs rgyas zhi gyur pa //
analyzed: kun mkhyen sangs rgyas zhi gyur pa //
translated: And attained peace, O Omniscient Buddha.

original: 'jig rten bsgral ba ma byas par //
analyzed: 'jig rten bsgral ba ma byas par //
translated: You have not liberated the world,

original: skyes bu dam pa grags mi srid //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa grags mi srid //
translated: And so, O Holy One, you are not famous.

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma rgyal ba legs so zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma rgyal ba legs so zhes gsol nas /
translated: “Excellent, Gautama!” said Ārāḍa Kālāma.

original: kun tu 'tsho nyer 'gro lam nas song ngo //
analyzed: kun tu 'tsho nyer 'gro lam nas song ngo //
translated: Then he went on his way.

original: de nas bcom 'das yul ka shi'i ljongs rgyu zhing @59b gshegs pa na w'a ra n'a sir byon to //
analyzed: de nas bcom 'das yul ka shi'i ljongs rgyu zhing @59b gshegs pa na w'a ra n'a sir byon to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, traveling through the country of Kāśi, arrived at Vārāṇasī.

original: de'i tshe lnga sde'i dge slong rnams w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe lnga sde'i dge slong rnams w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na 'khod do //
translated: At that time the five monks were staying at Vārāṇasī in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana.

original: lnga sde'i dge slong rnams kyis /
analyzed: lnga sde'i dge slong rnams kyis /
translated: The five monks

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
translated: saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang phan tshun nas ched du bsams te legs pa 'dug nas khrims su bcas pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang phan tshun nas ched du bsams te legs pa 'dug nas khrims su bcas pa /
translated: When they saw him, they made an agreement among themselves:🔽“This Gautama is coming here. He has given up his austerities and has returned to a life of comfort. He has abandoned the path of striving and has taken up a life of ease. He has given up the holy life and has returned to a life of indulgence. We should not bow down to him, stand up for him, or offer him a seat.

original: shes ldan dag dge sbyong go'u ta ma mi brtan pa /🔽bya ba mang ba /
analyzed: shes ldan dag dge sbyong go'u ta ma mi brtan pa / bya ba mang ba /
translated: “Sirs, the ascetic Gautama is unstable,

original: mang pos 'tsho ba /
analyzed: mang pos 'tsho ba /
translated: has many activities,🔽and is a provider for many.🔽He has lost his austerity, and now he eats a lot of food, such as rice and porridge, and anoints his body with sesame oil and then bathes in warm water.

original: spong ba nyams pa de da 'bras chan dang zan dron gyi kha zas la mang du za zhing lus mar sar dang til mar gyis byugs nas chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed cing 'ong gis da bdag cag gi drung du 'ongs pa dang / de la smra bar mi bya /
analyzed: spong ba nyams pa de da 'bras chan dang zan dron gyi kha zas la mang du za zhing lus mar sar dang til mar gyis byugs nas chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed cing 'ong gis da bdag cag gi drung du 'ongs pa dang / de la smra bar mi bya /
translated: So when he comes to us, we should not speak to him,

original: phyag mi bya /🔽ldang bar mi bya /
analyzed: phyag mi bya / ldang bar mi bya /
translated: bow to him,🔽or rise up for him.

original: langs te stan bstab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: langs te stan bstab par mi bya'o //
translated: We should not offer him a seat.

original: gzhan du na stan nar ma kho na bting la tshig 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gzhan du na stan nar ma kho na bting la tshig 'di skad ces /
translated: Instead, we should simply lay out a regular seat and say,

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma stan yod kyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma stan yod kyis /
translated: ‘Venerable Gautama, there is a seat.🔽If you like it, you may sit down.’

original: ji ste 'dod na 'dug cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes khrims bcas so //
analyzed: ji ste 'dod na 'dug cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes khrims bcas so //
translated: If he wishes to, he should stay.”🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ji ltar lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la gzigs pa'i phyir nye bar gshegs pa de lta de ltar lnga sde'i dge slong rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi gzi brjid dang / dpal dang bkur sti ma bzod nas stan las langs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ji ltar lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la gzigs pa'i phyir nye bar gshegs pa de lta de ltar lnga sde'i dge slong rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi gzi brjid dang / dpal dang bkur sti ma bzod nas stan las langs te /
translated: The five ascetics could not bear the Blessed One’s splendor, glory, and honor.

original: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan shom mo //
analyzed: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan shom mo //
translated: Some prepared seats for the Blessed One.

original: kha cig ni zhabs bkrus pa'i chu dang / zhabs kyi rten dag mtha' gcig tu 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni zhabs bkrus pa'i chu dang / zhabs kyi rten dag mtha' gcig tu 'jog par byed do //
translated: Some set out water for washing the feet and a foot stool to one side.

original: kha cig ni bsu ste na bza' chos gos dag blangs nas 'di skad ces shes ldan go'u ta ma tshur spyon /🔽shes ldan @60a *//
analyzed: kha cig ni bsu ste na bza' chos gos dag blangs nas 'di skad ces shes ldan go'u ta ma tshur spyon / shes ldan @60a *//
translated: Some came out to greet him, took his robe and bowl, and said, “Come, Venerable Gautama.

original: go'u ta ma byon pa legs so //
analyzed: go'u ta ma byon pa legs so //
translated: Welcome, Venerable Gautama.

original: shes ldan go'u ta ma stan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig ces zer ro //
analyzed: shes ldan go'u ta ma stan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig ces zer ro //
translated: Venerable Gautama, please sit in the prepared seat.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: kye ma skyes bu blun po 'di rnams kyis khrims bcas nas /
analyzed: kye ma skyes bu blun po 'di rnams kyis khrims bcas nas /
translated: “Alas, these foolish men have made a rule:

original: rang gis bshig go snyam du mkhyen nas gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //🔽de nas lnga sde'i dge slong rnams lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nas brjod /
analyzed: rang gis bshig go snyam du mkhyen nas gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so // de nas lnga sde'i dge slong rnams lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nas brjod /
translated: “I will destroy it myself,” he thought, and sat down on the very seat he had prepared.

original: gdung nas brjod /
analyzed: gdung nas brjod /
translated: Then the five ascetic monks began to call the Blessed One by his name and by the name of his clan,

original: tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa kun tu brjod par byed do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa kun tu brjod par byed do //
translated: and to address the venerable ones as “venerable.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the five ascetic monks,🔽“Monks, do not call the Thus-Gone One by his name and by the name of his clan,

original: dge slong dag khyed lhag par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nas brjod pa dang / gdung nas brjod pa dang / tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa kun tu ma brjod cig /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed lhag par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nas brjod pa dang / gdung nas brjod pa dang / tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa kun tu ma brjod cig /
translated: and do not address the venerable ones as ‘venerable.’

original: khyed la yun ring por gnod pa dang / phan pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed la yun ring por gnod pa dang / phan pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This will not be of benefit to you, but will be a cause of harm, misfortune, and suffering for a long time.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?” they asked.

original: dge slong dag gang la la lhag par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nas brjod pa dang / gdung nas brjod pa dang; tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa'i kun tu brjod pa de ni skyes bu blun po de la yun ring por gnod pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang la la lhag par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nas brjod pa dang / gdung nas brjod pa dang; tshe dang ldan pas brjod pa'i kun tu brjod pa de ni skyes bu blun po de la yun ring por gnod pa dang /
translated: “Monks, those who recite the name of the Thus-Gone One, recite his lineage, and recite the words of the venerable one will, for a long time, experience harm,

original: phan pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: unwholesomeness, and suffering.”

original: de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They replied,🔽“Venerable Gautama, you have not yet attained any of the higher qualities of the noble ones, which are beyond the level of ordinary humans,

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma khyod kyis re zhig sngon gyi tshul dang / spyod pa dang / dga' ba spyad pa des mi'i chos bla ma 'phags pa'i khyad par thob par nus pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma khyod kyis re zhig sngon gyi tshul dang / spyod pa dang / dga' ba spyad pa des mi'i chos bla ma 'phags pa'i khyad par thob par nus pa'am /
translated: through your former conduct, behavior, and enjoyment of pleasures.🔽You have not attained any of the higher qualities of the noble ones, which are beyond the level of ordinary humans,

original: shes pa'am @60b mthong ba'am /
analyzed: shes pa'am @60b mthong ba'am /
translated: through your knowledge, seeing,

original: reg par gnas pa cung zad kyang ma thob na /
analyzed: reg par gnas pa cung zad kyang ma thob na /
translated: or abiding in the present.

original: da ltar khyod mi brtan zhing bya ba mang la /
analyzed: da ltar khyod mi brtan zhing bya ba mang la /
translated: Now you are unstable and have many activities.

original: mang pos 'tsho zhing spong ba nyams pas da khyod 'bras chan dang zan dron dang kha zas la mang du za zhing /
analyzed: mang pos 'tsho zhing spong ba nyams pas da khyod 'bras chan dang zan dron dang kha zas la mang du za zhing /
translated: You live with many people and have lost your austerity. Now you eat a lot of rice, barley, and food.

original: lus mar sar dang til mar gyis byugs nas chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: lus mar sar dang til mar gyis byugs nas chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention anointing the body with sesame oil and bathing in warm water?

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal mdog dang dbang po rnams gsal ba sngon las tha dad du bya ba gzhan lta mthong ngam /🔽de rnams kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal mdog dang dbang po rnams gsal ba sngon las tha dad du bya ba gzhan lta mthong ngam / de rnams kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Monks, do you see any difference in the complexion and faculties of the Tathāgata compared to before?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma de de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa go'u ta ma de de bzhin no //
translated: They replied, “Venerable Gautama, it is so.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks of the group of five:

original: dge slong dag rab tu byung bas ni mtha' 'di gnyis la brten par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong dag rab tu byung bas ni mtha' 'di gnyis la brten par mi bya /
translated: “Monks, those who have gone forth should not rely on these two extremes.

original: bsnyen par mi bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par mi bya /
translated: They should not follow them,

original: bsnyen bkur mi bya ste /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi bya ste /
translated: nor should they revere them.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su brtson pa dman pa ngan pa tha chad ma rabs gang yin pa dang / bdag nyid dub pa la rjes su brtson pa sdug bsngal ba 'phags pa ma yin pa gnod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su brtson pa dman pa ngan pa tha chad ma rabs gang yin pa dang / bdag nyid dub pa la rjes su brtson pa sdug bsngal ba 'phags pa ma yin pa gnod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suffering, non-noble, and harmful pursuit of one’s own exhaustion is the pursuit of exhaustion.🔽“You should not rely on these two extremes, but on the middle way,

original: khyod kyis mtha' 'di gnyis la mi brten par dbu ma'i lam mig byed pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis mtha' 'di gnyis la mi brten par dbu ma'i lam mig byed pa /
translated: which is the eye,

original: ye shes byed pa /
analyzed: ye shes byed pa /
translated: the knowledge,

original: nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba mngon par shes pa dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: the peace, the superknowledge, the complete awakening, and the nirvana.

original: dbu ma'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the middle way?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the noble eightfold path, which consists of🔽right view,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i @61a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i @61a *//
translated: right thought,

original: rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang; yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang; yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la shes par bya ba 'dis shes par mdzad spyod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la shes par bya ba 'dis shes par mdzad spyod pas /
translated: The Blessed One made the five ascetic monks understand through this knowledge.

original: bcom ldan 'das lnga sde'i dge slong rnams las gnyis la snga dro gdams ngag 'bogs pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lnga sde'i dge slong rnams las gnyis la snga dro gdams ngag 'bogs pa na /
translated: The Blessed One gave instructions to two of the five ascetic monks in the morning,

original: gsum grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gsum grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug ste /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lnga sde rnams kyi dge slong gsum la phyi dro gdams ngag 'bogs na /

analyzed: gnyis grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug ste /
translated: while two went to the village for alms.

original: gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa gang yin pa des lnga sde 'tsho bar byed de /
analyzed: gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa gang yin pa des lnga sde 'tsho bar byed de /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni snga dro'i dus kho nar gsol ba yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata eats only in the morning and does not eat in the evening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the five monks:

original: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa skyes so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa skyes so //

original: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa skyes so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa skyes so //
translated: Knowledge, understanding, insight, and realization arose.

analyzed: shes pa dang rig pa dang blo dang rtogs pa skyes so //

original: dang rig pa dang blo dang rtogs pa skyes so //

translated: Knowledge, understanding, insight, and realization arose in me.

translated: “Monks, when I properly contemplated the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering, which I had not heard previously, with the knowledge born of awakening I cultivated it.

original: shes pa dang rig pa dang blo dang rtogs pa skyes so //
analyzed: shes pa dang rig pa dang blo dang rtogs pa skyes so //

analyzed: dge slong dag ji srid du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di rnams la de ltar lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i mig ma skyes /

analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs de bka' stsal pa na /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ko'u di n+ya dang / lha brgyad khri chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa ko'u di n+ya la bka' stsal pa /

original: ko'u di n+ya khyod kyis kun shes sam /

translated: “Kauṇḍinya, have you understood all?”

analyzed: zhes sa bla'i gnod sbyin rnams sgra sgrog par byed do //

analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang ldan pa / dge sbyong ngam /

translated: The yakṣas of the earth heard the sound and passed it on to the yakṣas of the atmosphere, the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyikas, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇa­rata gods, and the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang ldan pa dag dge sbyong ngam /

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir bskor bas lha'i ris mngon par 'phel zhing /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir bskor bas lha'i ris mngon par 'phel zhing /
translated: Therefore, the classes of gods increased,

original: lha ma yin gyi ris yongs su nyams so zhes dbyangs bsgrags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis w'a ra n'a sir drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags su lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang ldan pa bskor bas de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi ris yongs su nyams so zhes dbyangs bsgrags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis w'a ra n'a sir drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags su lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang ldan pa bskor bas de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba
translated: and the classes of asuras decreased.”🔽The Blessed One turned the wheel of Dharma in the Deer Park in Vārāṇasī, rolling it three times and with twelve aspects.

analyzed: zhes tshig bla dvags su btags so //

analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /

original: bden pa gang zhe na /🔽skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: bden pa gang zhe na / skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: “What is the noble truth of suffering?

analyzed: gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Birth is suffering, aging is suffering, sickness is suffering, death is suffering, encountering what is unpleasant is suffering, separation from what is pleasant is suffering, not obtaining what one desires is suffering, in brief, the five aggregates subject to clinging are suffering.

analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa /

analyzed: de dang de la mngon par 'dod pa ste /

analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering?

original: yang srid pa'i sred ba dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de nyid ma lus par spangs pa dang / bor ba dang / bsal ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /🔽'gag pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa ste /

translated: It is the complete abandonment and cessation of that very craving, the giving up and rejecting of it, freedom from attachment, the cessation of it, the nondelight in it, and the nonadherence to it.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the noble eightfold path, which consists of

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag @64b pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag @64b pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and🔽right concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This should also be cultivated.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: the Venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya’s mind was liberated from contaminants without further appropriation.

analyzed: lnga sde'i dge slong lhag ma rnams la ni chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so //
translated: The remaining five monks gave rise to the dust-free, stainless Dharma eye.

analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa gcig dang / gnyis pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dge slong lnga sde lhag ma rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the remaining five monks:

analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs ni bdag ma yin no //
translated: “Monks, form is not the self.

original: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin na /
translated: Monks, if form were the self,

translated: He then delighted them with a discourse on giving, on morality, on rebirth in the heavens, on the drawbacks, defilements, and degradation of desire, and on the benefits of renunciation and seclusion.

analyzed: mi slob pa'i shes pa dang / mi slob pa'i lta bas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas /

analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar dgra bcom pa mngon sum du bgyis lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / dge slong dag grags pa 'di nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pas gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i las dag byas shing bsags te; 'di nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, Yaśodharā herself has committed and accumulated actions whose effects are certain, whose results are stored up, and which therefore must ripen.

original: gis myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gis myong bar 'gyur /
translated: Who else will experience the actions that she herself has committed and accumulated?

analyzed: dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Monks, actions that have been committed and accumulated are never lost,🔽even if a hundred eons have passed.

analyzed: chu'i khams la @72b rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /🔽me'i khams la mi 'gyur /🔽rlung gi khams la mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: 'di ltar las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa dag ni zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that is committed and accumulated ripens on the appropriated aggregates, elements and sense bases.

original: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //🔽chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //
analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni // chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //
translated: Karma does not expire even in one hundred eons,

original: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
translated: but when the assemblage and time are found,

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: it will ripen into results for embodied beings.
