original: de'i tshe ser skya'i gzhi na bram ze lha zhes bya ba phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe ser skya'i gzhi na bram ze lha zhes bya ba phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
translated: At that time, in Kapilavastu, there lived a wealthy, prosperous, and opulent brahmin named Deva.🔽He had been a friend of the Blessed One in the past.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon gyi thugs reg por gyur pa zhig gnas pa de dus gzhan zhig na gnyen zad nor zad 'byor pa zad par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon gyi thugs reg por gyur pa zhig gnas pa de dus gzhan zhig na gnyen zad nor zad 'byor pa zad par gyur to //
translated: At one time, his relatives, wealth, and resources were exhausted.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug bcom nas bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug bcom nas bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One had conquered the thirty-six million māras and attained unsurpassed wisdom,

original: bram ze lha chung ma dang lhan cig grong khyer sde can du 'ongs so //
analyzed: bram ze lha chung ma dang lhan cig grong khyer sde can du 'ongs so //
translated: the brahmin Deva, together with his wife, came to the city of Śrāvastī.

original: bram ze lhas bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i @77b ye shes brnyes so zhes thos nas /
analyzed: bram ze lhas bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i @77b ye shes brnyes so zhes thos nas /
translated: The brahmin Deva heard that the Blessed One had attained unsurpassed wisdom.

original: des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
analyzed: bzang mo bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
translated: Bhadratī, the Blessed One has attained unsurpassed wisdom.

original: 'khor lo sgyur ba'i rigs su 'khrungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la gshegs na /
analyzed: 'khor lo sgyur ba'i rigs su 'khrungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la gshegs na /
translated: The Blessed One, who was born into the caste of universal monarchs, went to the city of Śrughna for alms.

original: bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das de la bsod snyoms dbul du gang gi phyir bdag gi khyim na nyi ma gcig gi kha zas kyang med kyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das de la bsod snyoms dbul du gang gi phyir bdag gi khyim na nyi ma gcig gi kha zas kyang med kyi /
translated: “We should offer alms to that Blessed One.

original: ngas khyod gtar bcug ste /
analyzed: ngas khyod gtar bcug ste /
translated: I will have you bled.

original: kar sha pa na lnga zhig skyin par blangs so //
analyzed: kar sha pa na lnga zhig skyin par blangs so //
translated: I will take five kārṣāpaṇas as payment.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: rje'i sras de bzhin du mdzod cig /
analyzed: rje'i sras de bzhin du mdzod cig /
translated: “Sir, do it that way.”

original: bram ze lhas chung ma bram ze zhig la gtar bcug nas kar sha pa na lnga bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol ba'i phyir skyin pa'i tshul du blangs so //
analyzed: bram ze lhas chung ma bram ze zhig la gtar bcug nas kar sha pa na lnga bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol ba'i phyir skyin pa'i tshul du blangs so //
translated: The young brahmin Deva had a brahmin bled and took five kārṣāpaṇas as payment to offer to the Blessed One for his meal.

original: de'i chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i chung mas smras pa /
translated: His wife said,

original: rje'i sras bdag ni byang chub sems dpas lan 'ga' yang dri ma can dang / gos ngan pa gyon pa ma gzigs so //
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag ni byang chub sems dpas lan 'ga' yang dri ma can dang / gos ngan pa gyon pa ma gzigs so //
translated: “Sir, the Bodhisattva has never seen me dirty or wearing poor clothes.

original: bram ze lhas khyim bdag cig las rgyan rnams brnyan nas chung ma la bskon no //
analyzed: bram ze lhas khyim bdag cig las rgyan rnams brnyan nas chung ma la bskon no //
translated: The brahmin Deva borrowed some jewelry from a certain householder, put it on his wife,

original: de nas bram ze lha chung ma dang lhan cig gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag sta gon byas nas /
analyzed: de nas bram ze lha chung ma dang lhan cig gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag sta gon byas nas /
translated: and prepared a pure and fine meal with his wife.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then he went to the Blessed One and, on arrival,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das bdag gi sdum par gdugs tshod sbyor zhing mchis na gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das bdag gi sdum par gdugs tshod sbyor zhing mchis na gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: said to him, “May the Blessed One acquiesce to my offer of a meal at my house tomorrow, together with the Saṅgha of monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze lha la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze lha la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One acquiesced to the brahmin Deva by remaining silent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das bram ze lha'i bkad sa gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das bram ze lha'i bkad sa gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the brahmin Deva’s reception hall, where he sat on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas bram ze lhas bcom ldan 'das bde bar bzhugs pa rig nas chung ma dang lhan cig tu gtsang zhing bsod @78a *//
analyzed: de nas bram ze lhas bcom ldan 'das bde bar bzhugs pa rig nas chung ma dang lhan cig tu gtsang zhing bsod @78a *//
translated: Then the brahmin Deva, discerning that the Blessed One had sat comfortably, together with his wife,🔽served and satisfied him with his own hands with a pure, fine meal.

original: pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas stobs shing tshim par byed do //
analyzed: pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas stobs shing tshim par byed do //
translated: with his own hands he served and satisfied them with various kinds of good hard and soft food.

original: rnam grangs du mar gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas bstabs shing tshim par byas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas bstabs shing tshim par byas so //
translated: In many ways he served and satisfied them with his own hands with pure, excellent, hard and soft food.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zin nas phyag bcabs te lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zin nas phyag bcabs te lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
translated: When the Blessed One had finished his meal, washed his hands and put away his bowl, he took a low seat and sat in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze lha la yon bsngo ba mdzad nas gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze lha la yon bsngo ba mdzad nas gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having dedicated the merit to the gods, departed.

original: de'i chung mas rgyan rnams bkrol te bzhag pa de ma byin par len pas brkus so zhes bram ze las thos nas sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i chung mas rgyan rnams bkrol te bzhag pa de ma byin par len pas brkus so zhes bram ze las thos nas sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gyur te /
translated: When the wife heard from the brahmin that the ornaments had been stolen by a thief, she was unhappy and distressed.

original: 'brog dkon pa zhig tu song nas nga la rgyan sbyin du ga la yod /
analyzed: 'brog dkon pa zhig tu song nas nga la rgyan sbyin du ga la yod /
translated: In a place where there is no grass, how can I give ornaments to myself?

original: gzhan byar med kyis bdag 'chi'o snyam pa dang / ji tsam na mi zhig gis dong bskos nas song ngo //
analyzed: gzhan byar med kyis bdag 'chi'o snyam pa dang / ji tsam na mi zhig gis dong bskos nas song ngo //
translated: Then a man came along, digging a hole.

original: bram ze lha ngo mtshar skyes nas de na ci yod re zhig blta'o snyam pa las /
analyzed: bram ze lha ngo mtshar skyes nas de na ci yod re zhig blta'o snyam pa las /
translated: The brahman was amazed and thought, What is in there? I will look.

original: ji tsam na rgyan de mthong nas des rgyan de blangs te khyim du 'ongs so //
analyzed: ji tsam na rgyan de mthong nas des rgyan de blangs te khyim du 'ongs so //
translated: When he saw the ornament, he took it and went home.

original: ji tsam na lha'i chung ma yang sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas gdungs nas khyim phyag dar byed pa na /
analyzed: ji tsam na lha'i chung ma yang sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas gdungs nas khyim phyag dar byed pa na /
translated: Then the wife of the god, tormented by suffering and mental unease, was cleaning the house.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / lha rnams kyi lha'i mthus ji tsam na gser gyi bum pa 'tsher bag can zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / lha rnams kyi lha'i mthus ji tsam na gser gyi bum pa 'tsher bag can zhig mthong ngo //
translated: By the power of the Buddha and the divine power of the gods, she saw a shining golden vase.

original: lhas de la dris pa bzang mo 'o ni ci yin /
analyzed: lhas de la dris pa bzang mo 'o ni ci yin /
translated: The god asked her, My dear, what is that?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: rje'i sras bdag gis gser gyi bum pa zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag gis gser gyi bum pa zhig mthong ngo //
translated: Lord, I see a golden vase.

original: des kyang smras pa /
analyzed: des kyang smras pa /
translated: He also said,

original: bzang mo kho bos kyang rgyan de mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzang mo kho bos kyang rgyan de mthong ngo //
translated: My dear, I also see that ornament.

original: de gnyis kyis lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das @78b la dad pa bskyed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das @78b la dad pa bskyed do //
translated: They developed even more faith in the Blessed One.

original: de ltar mngon par dad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyis kyis ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad pa mdzad pas bram ze lha chung ma dang bcas te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par dad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyis kyis ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad pa mdzad pas bram ze lha chung ma dang bcas te /
translated: As they had developed faith, the Blessed One taught them the Dharma in such a way that they realized the Four Noble Truths.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i nub mo 'das nas snga dro na bza' sham thabs mnabs /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so // de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i nub mo 'das nas snga dro na bza' sham thabs mnabs /
translated: The brahmin and his wife destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where they sat.🔽Then, after the night had passed, the Blessed One donned his lower garment and Dharma robes,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos bsnams te /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos bsnams te /
translated: and, carrying his alms bowl,

original: grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: he entered the town of Sāketa for alms.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong khyer sde can du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: As the Blessed One was entering the town of Sāketa for alms,🔽he thought,

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought as follows.🔽

original: ma la ngas grong khyer sde can der thog mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam pa las /
analyzed: ma la ngas grong khyer sde can der thog mar su zhig la chos bshad snyam pa las /
translated: “Mother, I am wondering to whom I should teach the Dharma first in the city of Senāpati.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: ngas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ngas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma la thog mar chos bshad par bya ste /
translated: “I should teach the Dharma first to the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā.

original: de dag gis nga sngon sdug bsngal spong ba'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson pas gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis nga sngon sdug bsngal spong ba'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson pas gnas pa na /
translated: When I was previously living in the practice of austerities,

original: 'dis mar sar dang 'o thug sbrang rtsi ltar mngar bas bsnyen bkur byas so snyam mo //
analyzed: 'dis mar sar dang 'o thug sbrang rtsi ltar mngar bas bsnyen bkur byas so snyam mo //
translated: they served me with milk, rice porridge, and honey-sweet food.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma'i khyim gang na ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma'i khyim gang na ba der gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the house of the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā.

original: grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: The village girls Nandā and Nandabalā saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan bshams nas 'di skad ces kyang gsol to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan bshams nas 'di skad ces kyang gsol to //
translated: When they saw him, they prepared a seat for the Blessed One and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das tshur spyon /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshur spyon /
translated: “Come, Blessed One!

original: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa 'di nyid la @79a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so // bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa 'di nyid la @79a *//
translated: “Blessed One, it is excellent that you have come.

original: bzhugs su gsol zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: bzhugs su gsol zhes gsol nas /
translated: Blessed One, please sit on this very seat that is prepared.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa de nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa de nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One sat on the prepared seat.

original: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te /🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te / phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Then Nanda and Nandabalā, the village girls, bowed their heads to the Blessed One’s feet🔽and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: As they sat to one side,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: the Blessed One taught Nanda and Nandabalā, the village girls, with a discourse on the Dharma that was appropriate for them.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He inspired them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad de /
translated: enthused them, and delighted them.🔽He instructed them, revealed, clarified, and taught them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thog ma'i dus su chos kyi gtam gleng ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thog ma'i dus su chos kyi gtam gleng ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the kind of Dharma talk that the blessed buddhas give at the beginning:

original: sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / mtho ris kyi gtam dang / 'dod pa rnams la mnog chung zhing nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i rjes su bsngags pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / mtho ris kyi gtam dang / 'dod pa rnams la mnog chung zhing nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i rjes su bsngags pa dang /
translated: He taught the discourse on generosity, the discourse on moral discipline, the discourse on the higher realms, the discourse on the disadvantages of desire, the discourse on the disadvantages of the afflictions, the discourse on purification, the discourse on renunciation, the discourse on solitude,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos rgya cher bshad do //🔽gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dga' ba'i sems dang / dge ba'i sems dang / mgu pa'i sems dang // sgrib pa dang bral ba'i sems dang / skal pa dang ldan pa dang yang dag phul gyi chos bshad na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos rgya cher bshad do // gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dga' ba'i sems dang / dge ba'i sems dang / mgu pa'i sems dang // sgrib pa dang bral ba'i sems dang / skal pa dang ldan pa dang yang dag phul gyi chos bshad na /
translated: and the discourse on the qualities of the side of purification.🔽When the Blessed One saw that their minds were ready, welling up with joy, virtuous, open, free of doubt, capable, and worthy of the highest teachings,

original: shes par nus par gzigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes par nus par gzigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: he taught them the Dharma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag phul gyi chos bshad pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag phul gyi chos bshad pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: with its own meaning, its own phrasing, and the teaching of pure and complete noble conduct.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam de rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam de rgya cher bshad do //
translated: He taught them the four noble truths in detail: suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: dper na / gos gtsang ma nag nog med @79b pa tshon rtsi 'os pa'i nang du bcug na /
analyzed: dper na / gos gtsang ma nag nog med @79b pa tshon rtsi 'os pa'i nang du bcug na /
translated: For example, if you put clean, unsoiled cloth into dye,

original: tshon rtsi legs par 'dzin du btub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: tshon rtsi legs par 'dzin du btub pa de bzhin du /
translated: the dye will take well.

original: grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, while sitting right there, Kṛṣṇā and Supriyā, the village girls, directly experienced the four noble truths:

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mngon par rtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mngon par rtogs so //
translated: suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas chos mthong ba dang / chos thob pa dang / chos rig pa dang / chos kyi gting slebs pa dang / the tshom las rgal ba dang / som nyi las rgal ba dang /
analyzed: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas chos mthong ba dang / chos thob pa dang / chos rig pa dang / chos kyi gting slebs pa dang / the tshom las rgal ba dang / som nyi las rgal ba dang /
translated: Then Kṛṣṇā and Supriyā, the village girls, having seen the Dharma, attained the Dharma, having known the Dharma, having fathomed the Dharma, having crossed over doubt, having no more perplexity,

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyis mi bkri ba dang / ston pas bstan pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob nas stan las langs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyis mi bkri ba dang / ston pas bstan pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob nas stan las langs te / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: They rose from their seats,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽btsun pa bdag cag 'phags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // btsun pa bdag cag 'phags so //
translated: and with palms placed together they bowed to the Blessed One and said to him,🔽“Blessed One, we have gone forth!

original: mngon par 'phags so //
analyzed: mngon par 'phags so //
translated: We have truly gone forth!

original: bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dang chos dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi lags kyis /
analyzed: bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dang chos dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi lags kyis /
translated: We go for refuge to the Blessed One, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha of monks.

original: dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
analyzed: dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept us as lay vow holders.

original: deng slan chad ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog dang yang bsdos te skyabs su mchi bar mngon par dad lags so //
analyzed: deng slan chad ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog dang yang bsdos te skyabs su mchi bar mngon par dad lags so //
translated: From this day forth for as long as we live, we will go for refuge with our very lives.”

original: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Nanda and Nandabalā, the village girls, said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa de'i slad du 'dir zhal zas kyi mdzad pa mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa de'i slad du 'dir zhal zas kyi mdzad pa mdzad du gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please accept our invitation to partake of a meal here.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā by remaining silent.

original: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig cing /🔽bcom ldan 'das bde @80a *//🔽bar bzhugs par rig nas gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas stobs shing tshim par byed de /🔽rnam grangs du mar gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas bstabs shing tshim par byas so //
analyzed: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig cing / bcom ldan 'das bde @80a *// bar bzhugs par rig nas gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas stobs shing tshim par byed de / rnam grangs du mar gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas bstabs shing tshim par byas so //
translated: Then the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zin te phyag bcabs shing lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas /🔽stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zin te phyag bcabs shing lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas / stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te /
translated: and knowing that the Blessed One had finished his meal and put away his bowl,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khod do //
translated: took a low seat and sat before the Blessed One in order to hear the Dharma.🔽The Blessed One, with countless skillful means, instructed, inspired,🔽enthused, and delighted them.🔽When the Blessed One knew that their minds were ready—malleable, free of hindrances, uplifted, and bright—🔽he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:🔽suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.🔽Just as a clean piece of cloth takes the dye well,🔽in the same way, while they were sitting right there, the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā🔽saw the truths:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: enthused, and delighted the village girls Nandā and Nandabalā.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: Having instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: enthused, and delighted them with talk about the Dharma, he rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong khyer sde can nas gshegs pa na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong khyer sde can nas gshegs pa na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then, as the Blessed One was leaving the town of Sāgala, he thought,

original: ngas yul ma ga dha 'dir ngang tshul bzang por bkur ba'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang zhig dbang du byas na /
analyzed: ngas yul ma ga dha 'dir ngang tshul bzang por bkur ba'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang zhig dbang du byas na /
translated: “In this land of Magadha, who is a virtuous ascetic or brāhmaṇa that I could bring under my control?

original: de dbang du gyur pas tshegs chung dus skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur ba su zhig yod snyam mo //
analyzed: de dbang du gyur pas tshegs chung dus skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur ba su zhig yod snyam mo //
translated: If he comes under my control, then with little difficulty a great multitude will come under my control.”

original: de'i tshe lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa zhig yod pa de ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis bkur stir bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa zhig yod pa de ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis bkur stir bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang /
translated: At that time, the sage of Ārāḍa Kālāma, who was a hundred and twenty years old, was old, aged, and decrepit. He was honored, revered,

original: mchod par bya bas dgra bcom par bkur cing /
analyzed: mchod par bya bas dgra bcom par bkur cing /
translated: and worshipped by the people of Magadha, who regarded him as an arhat.

original: 'khor lnga brgya dang / ne ranydza na'i chu klung gi 'gram gyi bsti gnas na @80b dka' thub spyod do //
analyzed: 'khor lnga brgya dang / ne ranydza na'i chu klung gi 'gram gyi bsti gnas na @80b dka' thub spyod do //
translated: He practiced austerities with a retinue of five hundred on the bank of the Nairañjanā River.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /🔽lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa 'di ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis zhes bya ba nas dka' thub spyod do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te / lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa 'di ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis zhes bya ba nas dka' thub spyod do //
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,🔽“The sage of Ārāḍa Kālāma, who is a hundred and twenty years old, is old, aged, and decrepit. He is honored, revered,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du ste /
translated: and worshipped by the people of Magadha, who regard him as an arhat.🔽He practices austerities with a retinue of five hundred on the bank of the Nairañjanā River.

original: ma langs lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can dbang du byas te 'di dbang du gyur na tshegs chung dus skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: ma langs lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can dbang du byas te 'di dbang du gyur na tshegs chung dus skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: He thought, “If I can bring the naked ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa under my power, then with little difficulty I will bring a great multitude under my power.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas gang na bder gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas gang na bder gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the dwelling place of the naked ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa.

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyis bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyis bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: The naked ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan bshams nas /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi ched du gdan bshams nas /
translated: Having seen him, he prepared a seat for the Blessed One.

original: 'di skad ces kyang gsol to //🔽dge sbyong chen po tshur spyon /
analyzed: 'di skad ces kyang gsol to // dge sbyong chen po tshur spyon /
translated: He said this:🔽“Come, Great Ascetic!

original: dge sbyong chen po byon pa legs so //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po byon pa legs so //
translated: Welcome, Great Ascetic!

original: dge sbyong chen po yun ring po zhig lags na /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po yun ring po zhig lags na /
translated: Great Ascetic, it has been a long time.

original: gang nas 'khor te 'dir byon /
analyzed: gang nas 'khor te 'dir byon /
translated: From where have you come and gone forth?

original: dge sbyong chen po gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig ces gsol to //
translated: Great Ascetic, please sit on the prepared seat.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One sat on the prepared seat.

original: de nas lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can dang / bcom ldan 'das lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can dang / bcom ldan 'das lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then, the matted-hair ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and the Blessed One had various pleasant and joyful conversations, and then sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had sat to one side, the Blessed One said this to the matted-hair ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa:

original: 'od srung gal te khyod la mi bde ba med na khyod kyi me khang du bdag zhag gcig cig 'dug go /
analyzed: 'od srung gal te khyod la mi bde ba med na khyod kyi me khang du bdag zhag gcig cig 'dug go /
translated: “Kāśyapa, if it is not inconvenient for you, I would like to stay one night in your fire hut.”

original: @81a *// dge sbyong chen po bdag la mi bde ba ma mchis na 'on kyang de na klu gdug pa can zhig gnas te /
analyzed: @81a *// dge sbyong chen po bdag la mi bde ba ma mchis na 'on kyang de na klu gdug pa can zhig gnas te /
translated: “Great Ascetic, it is not inconvenient for me, but there is a fierce nāga there.

original: des khyod mtho btsams par 'gyur du mchi'o //
analyzed: des khyod mtho btsams par 'gyur du mchi'o //
translated: It might harm you.”

original: 'od srung khyod kyis re zhig gnang bar gyis shig dang mtho btsams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung khyod kyis re zhig gnang bar gyis shig dang mtho btsams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Kāśyapa, if you allow it, it will not harm me.”

original: dge sbyong chen po gal te khyod la mtho mi btsam na /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po gal te khyod la mtho mi btsam na /
translated: “Great Ascetic, if it will not harm you,

original: dge sbyong chen po ci bde ba kho nar bzhugs shig /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po ci bde ba kho nar bzhugs shig /
translated: “Great ascetic, please stay as long as you like.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi me khang gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas me khang gi phyi rol tu zhabs bsil nas me khang gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi me khang gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas me khang gi phyi rol tu zhabs bsil nas me khang gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the fire hut of Urubilvā-Kāśyapa and, after washing his feet outside the fire hut, entered the fire hut.

original: nyid kyis rtsva gding ba bshams nas sku drang por bsrang ste skyil mo krung bcas nas /
analyzed: nyid kyis rtsva gding ba bshams nas sku drang por bsrang ste skyil mo krung bcas nas /
translated: He spread out the grass seat himself, straightened his body, and sat down cross-legged.

original: dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag ste bzhugs so //
analyzed: dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag ste bzhugs so //
translated: He sat there with his attention directed toward mindfulness.

original: klu gdug pas bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: klu gdug pas bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: The evil nāga saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang khros pa'i mthus dud pa phyung ngo //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang khros pa'i mthus dud pa phyung ngo //
translated: When he saw him, he emitted smoke through the power of his anger.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus dud pa phyung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus dud pa phyung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One also emitted smoke through the power of his magical abilities.

original: klu gdug pas khros pa'i mthus 'bar bar byas so //
analyzed: klu gdug pas khros pa'i mthus 'bar bar byas so //
translated: The evil nāga blazed with the power of his anger.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One also entered the fire element.

original: de nas klu gdug pa khros pa'i mthu dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus me khang thams cad 'bar /🔽rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: de nas klu gdug pa khros pa'i mthu dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus me khang thams cad 'bar / rab tu 'bar /
translated: Then, by the power of the angry nāgas and the power of the Blessed One’s miracles, the fire-hut blazed,🔽it blazed intensely,

original: kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
translated: it blazed everywhere intensely,

original: me lce gcig tu gyur pas sreg par byed do //
analyzed: me lce gcig tu gyur pas sreg par byed do //
translated: and it burned as a single tongue of flame.

original: steng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can mtshan mo rgyu skar la lta ba na me khang thams cad 'bar /🔽rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: steng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can mtshan mo rgyu skar la lta ba na me khang thams cad 'bar / rab tu 'bar /
translated: The naked ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, looking at the stars in the night, saw that the fire-hut blazed,🔽it blazed intensely,

original: kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
translated: it blazed everywhere intensely,

original: me lce gcig tu gyur nas sreg par mthong ngo //
analyzed: me lce gcig tu gyur nas sreg par mthong ngo //
translated: and it burned as a single tongue of flame.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di snyam du @81b sems te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di snyam du @81b sems te /
translated: Having seen that, he thought this:

original: dge sbyong go'u ta ma chen po 'di ltar mdzes pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma chen po 'di ltar mdzes pa /
translated: “The great ascetic Gautama, so beautiful,

original: klu gdug pas thal bar byas par ma gyur grang /
analyzed: klu gdug pas thal bar byas par ma gyur grang /
translated: has not been reduced to ashes by the angry nāgas.

original: kyi hud nyon mongs pa bdag gi tshig ma nyan to snyam mo //
analyzed: kyi hud nyon mongs pa bdag gi tshig ma nyan to snyam mo //
translated: Alas, I did not listen to my own words.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought this:

original: nga lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can 'khor dang bcas pa chas bcad kyis /
analyzed: nga lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can 'khor dang bcas pa chas bcad kyis /
translated: “The naked ascetic Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and his retinue are ready.

original: ma la ngas rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba la sems mnyam par gzhag na /
analyzed: ma la ngas rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du bya ba la sems mnyam par gzhag na /
translated: “Mother, if I concentrate my mind on the kind of miracle I want to perform,

original: mes klu gdug pa'i me zil gyis mnan la des kyang de'i lus la gnod pa mi byed cing de dul bar mkhyen nas lhung bzed du bcug ste /
analyzed: mes klu gdug pa'i me zil gyis mnan la des kyang de'i lus la gnod pa mi byed cing de dul bar mkhyen nas lhung bzed du bcug ste /
translated: I can extinguish the poisonous snake’s fire with my own fire, and it will not harm my body. When I know it is tamed, I will put it in my alms bowl.

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can de la sbyin pa de lta bu zhig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can de la sbyin pa de lta bu zhig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will give this to the dreadlocked ascetic Urubilvā Kāśyapa.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du mdzad pa la thugs mnyam par gzhag na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul ji lta bu mngon par 'du mdzad pa la thugs mnyam par gzhag na /
translated: Then the Blessed One concentrated his mind on the kind of miracle he wanted to perform,

original: mes klu gdug pa'i me zil gyis mnan la des kyang de'i lus la gnod pa mi byed pa de lta bu mngon par 'du mdzad de de dul bar mkhyen nas lhung bzed du bcug ste /
analyzed: mes klu gdug pa'i me zil gyis mnan la des kyang de'i lus la gnod pa mi byed pa de lta bu mngon par 'du mdzad de de dul bar mkhyen nas lhung bzed du bcug ste /
translated: and he extinguished the poisonous snake’s fire with his own fire, and it did not harm his body. When he knew it was tamed, he put it in his alms bowl.

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gang na ba der bsnams te gshegs so //
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gang na ba der bsnams te gshegs so //
translated: He then took it to the dreadlocked ascetic Urubilvā Kāśyapa.

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyis /
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyis /
translated: The dreadlocked ascetic Urubilvā Kāśyapa

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he saw him, he said to the Blessed One,

original: dge sbyong chen po gson pa lta zhig /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po gson pa lta zhig /
translated: “Great Ascetic, you are alive!

original: 'od srung gson no //
analyzed: 'od srung gson no //
translated: “Kāśyapa, I am alive.

original: dge sbyong chen po khyod kyis lhung bzed na bsnams te byon pa ci /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po khyod kyis lhung bzed na bsnams te byon pa ci /
translated: “Great Ascetic, what is in your alms bowl?”

original: 'od srung klu gdug pa gang gi mthus khyod kyi me khang du mir gyur pa rdzu 'phrul dang mi ldan pa gnas su mi ster ba de ngas btul nas lhung bzed du bcug nas khyer te 'ongs so //🔽de nas lteng rgyas 'od srung ral @82a *//
analyzed: 'od srung klu gdug pa gang gi mthus khyod kyi me khang du mir gyur pa rdzu 'phrul dang mi ldan pa gnas su mi ster ba de ngas btul nas lhung bzed du bcug nas khyer te 'ongs so // de nas lteng rgyas 'od srung ral @82a *//
translated: “Kāśyapa, I have subdued the evil nāga who, by his power, did not allow humans who lack supernormal knowledge to enter your fire hut. I put him in my alms bowl and brought him here.”

original: pa can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: pa can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then this occurred to the matted-hair ascetic Kāśyapa:

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong chen po rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong chen po rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin te /
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty.

original: ya mtshan che mod kyi bdag kyang dgra bcom pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: ya mtshan che mod kyi bdag kyang dgra bcom pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: Though he is amazing, I too am an arhat.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas kyi nags tshang tshing na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas kyi nags tshang tshing na bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One was staying in the Āṭānāṭā forest grove, the abode of Āṭānāṭā Kāśyapa.

original: de'i tshe lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas na bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya tsam me la yongs su spyod pa re re'i me thab gsum gsum ste me thab stong lnga brgya yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gyi bsti gnas na bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya tsam me la yongs su spyod pa re re'i me thab gsum gsum ste me thab stong lnga brgya yod do //
translated: At that time, in the abode of Āṭānāṭā Kāśyapa, there were about five hundred young brahmins who were fire worshippers, each with three fire altars, making one thousand five hundred fire altars.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de rnams me la yongs su spyod par 'dod na me de sbar bar ma nus so //
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de rnams me la yongs su spyod par 'dod na me de sbar bar ma nus so //
translated: Then, when those young brahmins wanted to tend the fires, they were unable to light those fires.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de rnams lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de rnams lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then those young brahmins went to where Āṭānāṭā Kāśyapa was and, on arrival,

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Āṭānāṭā Kāśyapa:

original: mkhan po mkhyen par mdzod cig /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: wearing saffron robes, seated in the company of five hundred followers, listening to the Dharma in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: mthong nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: 'od srung ral pa can 'di ni mchog yin la /

analyzed: de mchog ma yin nam /

analyzed: 'od srung dag 'di ni mchog yin te de ni ma yin no //

original: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung spun dag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mchog ma yin pa ma yin zhing chos bshad pa yang @95a *//
analyzed: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung spun dag 'di snyam du sems te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mchog ma yin pa ma yin zhing chos bshad pa yang @95a *//
translated: Then the two brothers Nadī-Kāśyapa and Gayā-Kāśyapa thought,

original: mchog ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: “The Blessed Buddha is not the worst, and the Dharma he teaches is not the worst,

original: gang gi phyir da ltar lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lhag lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa /🔽ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis bkur sti byas /🔽bla mar byas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar lteng rgyas 'od srung ral pa can btsas nas lo brgya nyi shu lhag lon pa rgas 'khogs gtugs pa / ma ga dha'i mi rnams kyis bkur sti byas / bla mar byas /

original: rjed par byas /
analyzed: rjed par byas /
translated: and respected by the people of Magadha,

analyzed: mchod par byas shing dgra bcom par bkur ba de yang lan gnyis kyi bar du dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar rab tu 'byung bar khas blangs kyis /
translated: He made offerings to them and honored them as arhats. He promised to go forth in the presence of the Great Ascetic two times.

analyzed: ma la bdag cag kyang dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: “Now we too will practice pure conduct in the presence of the Great Ascetic.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They said to the Bhagavān,

original: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa lta na /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa lta na /
translated: “Great Ascetic, if we may go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya,

original: bdag cag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
translated: we will practice pure conduct in the presence of the Great Ascetic.”

original: khyed kyis 'khor la bltas sam /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'khor la bltas sam /

original: dge sbyong chen po ma bltas lags so //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po ma bltas lags so //
translated: “Great Ascetic, we have not looked after it.”

original: 'od srung dag de'i phyir re zhig 'khor la ltos shig /
analyzed: 'od srung dag de'i phyir re zhig 'khor la ltos shig /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in that case, look after your retinue for a while.

original: 'di ltar khyed lta bu'i mi grags pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed lta bu'i mi grags pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is like this: You are famous people.

original: shes nyen can dag gis ni 'khor la blta ba legs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes nyen can dag gis ni 'khor la blta ba legs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are wise should look after their retinue.

original: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung spun rang gi bsti gnas gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bram ze'i khye'u rnams la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung spun rang gi bsti gnas gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bram ze'i khye'u rnams la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the two brothers, Aśvajit and Bhadrika, went to their own hermitage. When they arrived, they said to the young brahmins,

original: bram ze'i khye'u dag shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u dag shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Young brahmins, you should know that

original: kho bo cag ni dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par @95b spyad pa spyod na /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par @95b spyad pa spyod na /
translated: we will practice pure conduct in the presence of the Great Ascetic.

original: shes ldan dag ci byed /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ci byed /
translated: Sirs, what will you do?

original: mkhan po dag bdag cag cung zad ci 'tshal ba de thams cad ni mkhan po dag la brten nas lags kyis /
analyzed: mkhan po dag bdag cag cung zad ci 'tshal ba de thams cad ni mkhan po dag la brten nas lags kyis /
translated: “Preceptors, all that we have to live on is due to the preceptors.

original: gal te mkhan po dag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad na /
analyzed: gal te mkhan po dag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad na /
translated: If the preceptors practice pure conduct in the presence of the Great Ascetic,

analyzed: bdag cag kyang mkhan po rab tu byung ba'i rjes su rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: we will also go forth after the preceptors have gone forth.”

original: bram ze'i khye'u dag de'i dus da yin par shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u dag de'i dus da yin par shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Young brahmins, you should know that the time has come for that.

original: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang ga ya 'od srung spun gnyis 'khor nyis brgya lnga bcu lnga bcu dag /
analyzed: de nas chu klung 'od srung dang ga ya 'od srung spun gnyis 'khor nyis brgya lnga bcu lnga bcu dag /
translated: Then the two brothers, Nadī-Kāśyapa and Gayā-Kāśyapa, each with a retinue of two hundred and fifty,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste lhags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste lhags nas /
translated: went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: they said this to the Blessed One:

original: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag gis 'khor la bltas lags te /
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag gis 'khor la bltas lags te /
translated: “Great Ascetic, we have looked after our retinues.

original: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa lta na bdag cag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa lta na bdag cag dge sbyong chen po'i spyan sngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
translated: If the Great Ascetic will allow us to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, and to obtain the state of a fully ordained monk, then we will practice pure conduct in the presence of the Great Ascetic.”

original: 'od srung dag /
analyzed: 'od srung dag /
translated: “Kāśyapa!

original: tshur shog tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig /
analyzed: tshur shog tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig /
translated: Come here and practice pure conduct.”

original: de nyid kyis tshe dang ldan pa de rnams rab tu byung ba dang des bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / des dge slong gi dngos por gyur to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis tshe dang ldan pa de rnams rab tu byung ba dang des bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / des dge slong gi dngos por gyur to //
translated: By that alone, those venerable ones went forth, were fully ordained, and became monks.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can stong po de rab tu phyung /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can stong po de rab tu phyung /
translated: Then the Blessed One ordained the thousand dreadlocked ascetics.

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas lteng rgyas su ji tsam bzhed kyi bar du bzhugs nas /

original: ga ya gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /🔽rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa na ga yar byon nas ga ya na ga ya mgo'i mchod rten na sngon gyi ral @96a *//
analyzed: ga ya gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te / rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa na ga yar byon nas ga ya na ga ya mgo'i mchod rten na sngon gyi ral @96a *//
translated: and then he went wandering toward Gayā.

original: pa can thams cad rab tu byung ba'i dge slong stong dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: pa can thams cad rab tu byung ba'i dge slong stong dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: In due course he arrived at Gayā, and he stayed at Gayā’s Gayā­śīrṣa Caitya together with the thousand monks who had been dreadlocked ascetics and who had been ordained first.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong stong po de la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong stong po de la /
translated: Then the Blessed One instructed the thousand monks

original: rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis 'doms par mdzad de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis 'doms par mdzad de /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
translated: miracles of supernormal power, miracles of reading others’ minds, and miracles of instruction.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Blessed One’s miracle of supernormal power was this:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar thugs mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar thugs mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered into equipoise,

original: nyid kyis gdan gyi nang du mi snang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: nyid kyis gdan gyi nang du mi snang bar gyur cing /
translated: disappeared from his seat

original: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas /
translated: and rose up into the sky above the eastern direction.

original: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi mdzad de /
analyzed: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi mdzad de /
translated: He performed the four types of conduct:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'chag pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal bar mdzad do //🔽me'i ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par 'jug par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal bar mdzad do // me'i ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par 'jug par mdzad de /
translated: walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.🔽He also entered the meditative absorption of fire,

original: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: and when he entered the meditative absorption of fire,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs dag 'byin par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs dag 'byin par mdzad de /
translated: from the body of the Blessed Buddha various kinds of light rays emerged:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog go /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog go /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, and crystal-colored.

original: cho 'phrul zung du yang ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung du yang ston par mdzad de /
translated: He also displayed the twin miracle:

analyzed: sku'i smad nas 'bar bar mdzad la sku'i stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par mdzad do //
translated: from the lower part of his body he emitted flames, and from the upper part of his body he emitted cold water.

original: sku'i stod na 'bar bar mdzad la sku'i smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par mdzad pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin @96b la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: sku'i stod na 'bar bar mdzad la sku'i smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par mdzad pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin @96b la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: from the upper part of his body he emitted flames, and from the lower part of his body he emitted cold water.

original: shar phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the east, so also in the south, west, and north.

original: phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bstan nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bstan nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa rnams bsdus te /
translated: Having manifested the four kinds of miraculous power in the four directions, he withdrew his supernormal powers.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs te /🔽de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs te / de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: He sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.🔽This is the Blessed One’s miraculous power.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the Blessed One’s power of reading minds.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyi sems ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyi sems ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: “Monks, your minds are like this.

original: khyed kyi yid ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi yid ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: Your mind is like this.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: Your consciousness is like this.

original: 'di ni rtogs shig /
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs shig /
translated: Understand this.

original: 'di ni ma rtogs shig /
analyzed: 'di ni ma rtogs shig /
translated: Do not understand this.

original: 'di ni yid la byos shig /
analyzed: 'di ni yid la byos shig /
translated: Pay attention to this.

original: 'di ni yid la ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'di ni yid la ma byed cig /
translated: Do not pay attention to this.

original: 'di ni spongs shig /
analyzed: 'di ni spongs shig /
translated: Abandon this.

original: 'di ni ma spangs shig /
analyzed: 'di ni ma spangs shig /
translated: Do not abandon this.

original: 'di ni lus kyis mngon sum du byas la rdzogs par gyis te nos shig /
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis mngon sum du byas la rdzogs par gyis te nos shig /
translated: Make this manifest to yourself through your body and accept it completely.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: This is the Blessed One’s magical power of proclamation.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Blessed One’s magical power of instruction is as follows:

original: dge slong dag 'di thams cad ni kun tu 'bar ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di thams cad ni kun tu 'bar ba yin no //
translated: “Monks, all of this is burning.

original: dge slong dag thams cad kun tu 'bar ba de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag thams cad kun tu 'bar ba de ci yin zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is burning?

analyzed: dge slong dag mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa kun tu 'bar ba yin zhing mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang gi tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: Monks, the eye, forms, and eye consciousness are burning. Eye contact is burning. Conditioned by eye contact, internal feelings, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant, are burning.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: whether it is pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang kun tu @97a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang kun tu @97a *//
translated: unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant,

original: 'bar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bar ba yin no //
translated: that too is burning.🔽Monks, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind,

original: dge slong dag rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni kun tu 'bar ba yin zhing /🔽yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang gi tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong dag rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni kun tu 'bar ba yin zhing / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang gi tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: dharmas, mind consciousness, and mind contact are burning.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The pleasant,🔽unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang kun tu 'bar ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang kun tu 'bar ba yin no //
translated: feeling that arises in dependence on mind contact is burning.

original: gang gis kun tu 'bar zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis kun tu 'bar zhe na /
translated: By what is it burning?

original: 'dod chags kyi me dang / zhe sdang gi me dang / gti mug gi mes kun tu 'bar /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi me dang / zhe sdang gi me dang / gti mug gi mes kun tu 'bar /
translated: It is burning with the fire of passion, the fire of hatred, and the fire of delusion.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa ste /
translated: birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi kun tu 'bar ba'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi kun tu 'bar ba'o zhes smra'o //
translated: This is the burning of suffering.

original: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: This is the Blessed One’s teaching through miracles.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this Dharma discourse was explained,

original: sngon thams cad ral pa can du gyur pa'i dge slong de rnams len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: sngon thams cad ral pa can du gyur pa'i dge slong de rnams len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: the minds of all those monks who had previously been ascetics were liberated from defilements with no further grasping.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ga ya na ga ya mgo'i mchod rten la sngon thams cad ral pa can du gyur pa'i dge slong thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ga ya na ga ya mgo'i mchod rten la sngon thams cad ral pa can du gyur pa'i dge slong thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa / bya ba byas pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, at the Gayā Head Shrine, with all the monks who had previously been ascetics, all of whom were arhats whose defilements were exhausted,

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: who had done what had to be done,🔽who had accomplished their task,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: who had cast off their burdens,

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: who had attained their own goals,

original: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /

analyzed: skye ba na 'du byed rnams skye zhing 'gag pa na 'du byed rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /

original: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pas 'du byed kyi rgyud @105b nying mtshams sbyor ba thugs su chud nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba 'dogs par mdzad de /

analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi @106b phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong dag 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: dge slong dag de la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bdag @107b tu khas len par byed dam /
translated: “Is this my self?”

analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable Sir.”🔽“Great King, therefore, whatever form there is, whether past,🔽future, or present,🔽internal or external,
